title: WCAS CHEM 105-6-05 First-Year Seminar
topic: Sci & Tech Writing for Lay Aud

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
In this course we will read and discuss works on technical subjects written for a general audience with no special scientific training; the authors we'll be reading include Sam Kean, John McPhee, Don Norman, Richard Rhodes, Nate Silver and Lewis Thomas.

Although the course is not targeted exclusively to science majors, students enrolling in it should have enough of a background in the fundamental sciences to feel comfortable writing about technical topics.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
1. How to Write: Advice and Reflections by Richard Rhodes; New York: Harper-Collins; ISBN 0-688-14948-0
2. Deadly Feasts by Richard Rhodes; New York; Simon and Schuster, 1998; ISBN 0-684-84425-7
3. Additional course reading packet to be distributed by instructor; details provided on first day of class.
